title: French Montana buys Drake $175k diamond-encrusted name bracelet
text:
French Montana is channeling Tony Montana.

The 34-year-old Unforgettable rapper arrived for Drake's birthday celebrations in Hollywood on Wednesday night dressed as Al Pacino's character from the 1983 gangster film Scarface.

He was also carrying a lavish gift for his 33-year-old No Stylist collaborator - a piece of jewelry he claimed was worth a whopping $175k.

Gangster: French Montana, 34, arrived for Drake's birthday celebrations in Hollywood on Wednesday night dressed as Al Pacino's character from the 1983 gangster film Scarface

The diamond-encrusted bracelet French -real name Karim Kharbouch- flashed for photographers appeared to spell out his friend's name.

And Montana was not short on bling of his own, sporting several heavy chain necklaces underneath his red shirt and white suit combo.

The outfit was clear nod to the Brian DePalma classic film, in which Pacino played Cuban immigrant turned drug lord Tony Montana.

The movie is famous for its flamboyant 1980s fashion choices, including several gaudy outfits donned by its lead character, one of which clearly inspired Montana on Wednesday.

The Wiggle It hitmaker also added another flourish from the Oliver Stone penned crime saga: a sling holding up his left arm.

Drake celebrated his 33rd birthday at Goya Studios in Hollywood on Wednesday night.

The star-studded guest list for the evening included the likes of Adele, Snoop Dogg, P. Diddy and Chris Brown.

He also celebrated on Monday night at Poppy nightclub in West Hollywood, with Rihanna the highest profile well-wisher of that evening.
